image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The 51-year-old Canberra woman sobbed at times and interjected at others, during a court hearing for six charges including threats to kill and attempted aggravated burglary.

title.children: 'I'm going to kill you': Woman allegedly tries to break into former partner's home with hammer and crowbar

image.altText: A glass jar containing a brown powder sitting next to a ruler.

props.synopsis: The person who brought the sample to CanTEST for checking was "unaware" that it contained fentanyl and surrendered it.

title.children: User discards brown powder sample after drug testing finds it contains fentanyl

image.altText: A woman with long black hair stands in front of a microphone looking serious.

props.synopsis: With a current candidate's offensive social media posts coming to light, and a former candidate hitting back at criticism, the Liberals have spent a week talking about themselves.

title.children: After gathering momentum at the start of the campaign, the Canberra Liberals endured a week of 'unwelcome distractions'

image.altText: Close up of elder with ochre face paint and stage lights on the side of her face.

props.synopsis: Traditional song and dance and the latest digital technology come together to tell the never-to-be-forgotten story of a Yuin clan's mass drowning in the late 1800s.

title.children: 'Mind-blowing' production of NSW South Coast tragedy fuses traditional storytelling and cutting-edge stagecraft

image.altText: A car drives past a pole with a noise detection camera with a forest in the background.

props.synopsis: Noise cameras will be rolled out across two NSW council areas before the end of the year. The technology will target "anti-social behaviour and noisy vehicles", according to a NSW government tender.

title.children: NSW government to launch new noise cameras in the state

image.altText: a girl in a wheelchair wearing a headband with horns looking at rats

props.synopsis: It's estimated one in five children in Australia live with chronic pain, but they can often struggle to be understood and believed.

title.children: Other students wondered why Breana was 'so lazy', but they only saw her when she was well enough for school

image.altText: Treasure Boxes volunteers  2024-06-25 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Thousands of pregnant women in Australia are going hungry with many of those too scared to ask for help, according to new research.

title.children: One in ten expecting mothers are going hungry, survey finds

image.altText: shelves without eggs at supermarket.

props.synopsis: It has been months since a deadly bird flu outbreak devastated farms, but eggs remain in short supply across the country.

title.children: Seeing empty egg shelves? It could still take some time for Australia's supply to recover

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

props.synopsis: One of Victoria's peak Jewish community groups has described the appearance of Hezbollah flags at a Melbourne rally calling for ceasefires in Gaza and Lebanon as "highly alarming".

title.children: Police urged to lay charges after Hezbollah flag appears at Melbourne rally

image.altText: Two men wearing military gear walk town a street littered with debris.

props.synopsis: Palestinian militant group Hamas says an Israeli strike in south Lebanon has killed its leader, while another group says three of its leaders have been killed in a strike on Beirut — the first attack within the city limits.

title.children: IDF strikes kill Hamas leader in Lebanon as attacks reach Beirut city limits

image.altText: A woman wearing a black scarf reading Quran

props.synopsis: As more details emerge about the Israeli attack that killed Hezbollah's leader in Beirut, analysts say it's likely US-made 2,000 pound "bunker buster" bombs were used in the strikes carried out in the densely populated neighbourhood.

title.children: Israel used US-made 'bunker buster' bombs in attack on Hezbollah's leader, analysts say

image.altText: A woman with short hair looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Retirement villages are home to more than 250,000 older Australians, but some residents complain of exorbitant fees, oppressive contracts and a sense of feeling trapped.

title.children: 'An absolute minefield': How these villages became a trap for retirees

image.altText: A court sketch of Terence Kelly at his sentencing for the kidnapping of four-year-old Cleo Smith in WA's outback.

props.synopsis: Terence Kelly fails to get his sentence reduced for abducting four-year-old Cleo Smith from her family's campsite in remote WA three years ago, with a judge rejecting his claim that his mental impairments should have been given greater weight.

title.children: Man who abducted four-year-old Cleo Smith from family tent fails in bid to reduce sentence

image.altText: Two men in suits smile and laugh, one is holding a model Rex Airlines plane.

props.synopsis: Rex Airlines's bosses are no longer on speaking terms, but they exclusively told Four Corners the inside story of their failed bid to take on Qantas and Virgin and just who's to blame.

title.children: For the first time since its collapse, Rex bosses share the inside story of how it all went wrong

image.altText: A boy wrapped in a blue blanket stands next to a destroyed building.

props.synopsis: Russia has launched several waves of drone attacks targeting Kyiv, according to Ukraine's military, with air defence units engaged in repelling the strikes for several hours.

title.children: Ukrainian military reports waves of Russian drone attacks on Kyiv

image.altText: Michael Theo wears a Hawaiian shirt as he leans half from behind a black curtain, an awkward look on his face

props.synopsis: Michael Theo said he always felt like "a double scoop of dog crap". Now he's a leading man.

title.children: Doctors said Michael Theo might never talk. Now he's a TV star

image.altText: An aerial view of a highway cutting through rugged landscape

props.synopsis: Community leaders are going public with suspicions missing men may have been murdered after falling foul of the drug trade in outback Australia.

title.children: Suspicions are growing in northern towns that a violent drug trade is causing young men to disappear

image.altText: A portrait of a woman with long blonde hair wearing a dress in a black room.

props.synopsis: Nicola Gobbo will give evidence in the Supreme Court by video link, with the vision to be seen only by the judge and lawyers as she seeks damages because of the the way police used her as a secret gangland informer.

title.children: Nicola Gobbo's current appearance 'not the image' seen in the past, Victorian court hears

image.altText: A man with a neutral expression loosk at the camera, while holding up a mobile phone with a picture of a man on the screen

props.synopsis: On the streets of Beirut, some Hezbollah supporters are refusing to believe their leader, Hassan Nasrallah, is dead, while others are warning the man likely to replace him is more "hardline".

title.children: 'He is alive, they hid him': Denial, defiance among Hezbollah supporters as leader's body is pulled from rubble

image.altText: Five people stand in a line with their arms around each other's shoulders, while a crowd gathers behind them.

props.synopsis: Austria's Freedom Party has secured the first national parliamentary election victory for the country's far right since World War II, finishing ahead of the governing conservatives in the Austrian election race.

title.children: Austria's far-right wins first national election since WWII

image.altText: Power station towers seen on a countryside landscape and cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: The last coal-fired power station in the United Kingdom officially closes down today, book-ending the nearly-150-year history of British coal power.

title.children: UK becomes first G7 nation to end coal power with last plant closure

image.altText: A shopfront with flowers for sale

props.synopsis: Cost of living pressures are being felt right across the world, and Australia is no different. But how do the cost of our groceries actually compare?

title.children: Grocery prices compared between Australia, UK, NZ and Ireland — who comes out on top?

image.altText: A man walking while wearing a cap and glasses.

props.synopsis: Former Catholic church figurehead Christopher Saunders will go to a District Court trial after a not guilty plea to alleged sex crimes.

title.children: Former Bishop of Broome pleads not guilty to historical sex charges

image.altText: A large crowd of people on a rugby field.

props.synopsis: The record was previously held by France, who broke it in 2014 with more than 4,000 attempting the haka after a rugby match.

title.children: 'What the heck?' How New Zealand has claimed back the crown for a record haka from France

image.altText: Close up of Kris Kristofferson performing live, framed by microphone, harmonica and the head of his acoustic guitar

props.synopsis: Remember the late, great singer-songwriter via some of the best moments in his prolific recording catalogue, admired by everyone from Johnny Cash to Janis Joplin.

title.children: The five best Kris Kristofferson songs you need to hear today

image.altText: A sign at the front gate of bed and breakfast accommodation

props.synopsis: Steven Galcsik, 47, has been refused bail over the alleged domestic violence murder of his wife, Natalie, on Friday night at their bed and breakfast property at Pokolbin.

title.children: Natalie Galcsik's husband charged with murder, refused bail after she was found dead at their B&B property

image.altText: an illustration of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump standing back to back

props.synopsis: In an election likely to turn on a small shift of votes in a small number of states, seemingly small things could end up being of out-sized significance.

title.children: Beyond Harris and Trump, a multitude of small things could change the US election

image.altText: An older Palestinian man waves, surrounded by other Palestinian men

props.synopsis: Yahya Sinwar is at the top of Israel's most-wanted list. Here's how he rose to power.

title.children: How Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar got his nickname 'the butcher'

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 climbed 0.7 per cent and hit a new record close with last week's Chinese stimulus supporting the miners, despite a key federal government agency forecasting further price slides for mineral exports. Look back at the day's events.

title.children: ASX climbed 0.7pc to a new record high as Chinese stimulus fires up mining and energy stocks — as it happened

image.altText: Katy Gallagher, sitting with Jim Chalmers, holds the women's economic budget statement

props.synopsis: A drop in spending has delivered a $15.8 billion surplus for the most recent financial year, despite tax revenue also falling in that time. It's a $6.4 billion improvement on what was forecast in May.

title.children: Final budget result delivers $15.8 billion surplus due to lower spending

image.altText: Joe Daniher celebrates a grand final goal against Sydney

props.synopsis: If the 2024 grand final was Joe Daniher's last game at the AFL, he couldn't have scripted a better way to end things. The star forward's future hangs over Brisbane's drought-breaking flag, but won't halt its hopes of going back-to-back.

title.children: Brisbane won't want Joe Daniher to retire, but can still repeat as premiers if the grand final was his perfect farewell

image.altText: Tadej Pogačar holds out his arms and screams

props.synopsis: Only Tadej Pogačar could have even attempted a move described as "suicidal" by his rivals and still come out on top. The 26-year-old cyclist is rewriting the boundaries of what's possible at the world championships in Zurich.

title.children: Tadej Pogačar blows away opposition with 'crazy' attack to win world championships

image.altText: Nathan Cleary. favouring his left shoulder, walks off the field

props.synopsis: Nathan Cleary may be a wounded warrior in Sunday's NRL grand final, but the Storm will not be paying extra attention to the Panthers talisman.

title.children: Storm desperate to not repeat grand final mistake by targeting Nathan Cleary's injured shoulder

image.altText: Three girls

props.synopsis: They're already scoring goals on the field, but now these high-performance footballers are levelling up with a female-focused health training program.

title.children: After decades of sports science for '70kg white males', elite athlete training gets serious about women's health
